intro: Pedicularis contorta, commonly known as the twisted beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia and North America. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine environments, often in rocky or gravelly soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are upright and hairy. Pedicularis contorta is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
